page.title: 07AN OLD HOUSE IN CHELTENHAM
page.content: Treaford Cottage was built in the nineteenth century.It was used as a coaching house.The upstairs was for people to rest in after a coach journey, or maybe spend the night.Down stairs was used for the horses.There were two stables and two places to keep the coaches.Over the years Treaford Cottage was neglected,and became a tip.Then my family moved in.The place was said to be beyond repair,but my family got cracking and made the house livable again.It has seven rooms,two of which are very big.Outside there is a nice garden with a vegetable patch.We keep two rabbits in hutches but they often come indoors.
